title: ¬°Medalla para M√©xico! Gilda Cota gana la presea de plata en Lanzamiento de Bala en Par√≠s 2024
text:
Gilda Guadalupe Cota Vera gan√≥ una medalla de plata m√°s para M√©xico en los Juegos Paral√≠mpicos de Par√≠s 2024.
Durante este jueves, la mexicana logr√≥ el segundo lugar en la prueba de Lanzamiento de Bala F33 con su mejor registro de 7.89 m, que le vali√≥ tambi√©n el r√©cord paral√≠mpico de Am√©rica.
Te podr√≠a interesar:
¬°Una m√°s en para nataci√≥n! Arnulfo Castorena se lleva la medalla oro para M√©xico en Par√≠s 2024
El primer lugar y la medalla de oro fue para la representante de China, Qing Wu, con un lanzamiento de 7.98 m, registro con el tambi√©n se lleva r√©cord paral√≠mpico.
El tercer sitio y el bronce se qued√≥ en manos de Svetlana Krivenok, del grupo de atletas paral√≠mpicos neutrales, con un lanzamiento de 7.74 m.
Con esta presea, M√©xico ya cuenta con 12 medallas en estos Juegos de Par√≠s 2024: 3 de oro, 4 de plata y 5 de bronce.

author: VNExplorer
title: Justin Welby warns against divisions within the Church of England
text:
Church of England General Synod
The Archbishop of Canterbury has warned against division within the Church of England, as he described ‚Äúexpressions of hatred‚Äù in correspondence sent to his London home.
Mr Welby said such expressions were ‚Äúnormally coming from within the church‚Äù, and gave another example of someone who had been working on a project for the church and had feared opening their emails ‚Äúbecause of the bitterness and abuse‚Äù they faced.
In his presidential address to the General Synod as it opened on Friday, he said the fear and suffering which arise from division can make people see each other as enemies, something he said must be resisted.
At Lambeth (Palace), the brilliant member of staff who deals with the endless correspondence that comes in, is worn down by the expressions of hatred, normally coming from within the church
Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby
He said: ‚ÄúCauses of fear, which leads to a sense of enmity, are well-disguised as uncertainty, unpredictability and uncontrollability of life and, like barnacles on the hull of a ship, they attach themselves to make us see other people as our enemies, and that is the devil‚Äôs work.
‚ÄúEnemies make us afraid. Fear makes us suffer.
‚ÄúSomeone the Archbishop of York and I met recently from outside the church said that while they were working on a project for the church, they grew to fear opening their emails, because of the bitterness and abuse they were subject to.
‚ÄúAt Lambeth (Palace), the brilliant member of staff who deals with the endless correspondence that comes in, is worn down by the expressions of hatred, normally coming from within the church.‚Äù
Lambeth Palace is the London home of the Archbishop of Canterbury, his family and two religious communities, and is also described as the centre of his ministry, worship and hospitality.
As Lord Cameron said recently, when he looks around at the world today as foreign secretary, all the lights are flashing red
Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby
The church has been divided on issues such as blessings for same-sex couples, which were approved at Synod, the church‚Äôs parliament, last year, but are still strongly opposed by many church members.
More recently it has faced scrutiny from politicians over the conversions of asylum seekers to Christianity.
The case of Clapham alkali attack suspect Abdul Ezedi, believed to have been supported in his UK asylum claim by someone from a Baptist church rather than the Church of England, prompted debate on the overall issue of the involvement of faith leaders in conversions and asylum applications.
The Church of England has repeatedly said it is the ‚Äúduty of the Home Office, not the churches, to make decisions on asylum applications‚Äù, but has said it is considering an update on its 2017 guidance document for clergy on supporting asylum seekers.
Elsewhere in his speech Mr Welby spoke of the suffering raging across the world, with the war in Ukraine ‚Äúfrozen‚Äù, and the ‚Äúhavoc and horror‚Äù being experienced in the Middle East, as well as devastation in places including Myanmar, Sudan and the Democratic Republic of the Congo and poverty in the UK.
He said: ‚ÄúAs Lord Cameron said recently, when he looks around at the world today as foreign secretary, all the lights are flashing red.
‚ÄúWe live in a world of suffering and, unlike in the past, it is a world where we are aware of the suffering.‚Äù
Register now for one of the Evening Standard‚Äôs newsletters. From a daily news briefing to Homes & Property insights, plus lifestyle, going out, offers and more. For the best stories in your inbox, click here.

author: proeder
title: The Become Here Spotlight: November Staff Recognitions
text:
Nearly 5,000 people work to provide and support a quality education to more than 30,000 students in Des Moines. From school administrators and educators to bus drivers and technology professionals to food and nutrition providers to financial experts, these dedicated DMPS employees are committed to providing the best possible experience for students and families. Each month the Become Here Spotlight will shine on an administrator, an educator and a staff member to share a little more about the many people working to teach and support the children and students of our community, and in the words of those who nominated them for the recognition.
Mary Jo Cook
Substitute
Hillis Elementary School
Mary Jo is such a valuable part of the Hillis Elementary School team in the ways she provides classroom substitute support when certified staff are absent and in the many ways, she steps in to help when we are shorthanded. Mary Jo is well known by students, and she has established excellent relationships with the Hillis students as well as the Hillis staff. Mary Jo does not only help in our times when we are shorthanded, she also volunteers to serve on our Hillis A-Team which provides planned social activities for the purpose of building community, socialization and recognition of staff. There is literally nothing Mary Jo will not do for our Hillis team.
Mary Jo has taken on lunch duties, recess duties, assisted with setting up classrooms, assisted in preparing curriculum materials, cleaned out shelving areas and organized lost and found. Mary Jo had PERFECT attendance last year and did not miss one day of school. Mary Jo is a true champion for students, and we are so grateful she is serving at Hillis Elementary School!
Terry Allfree
Senior Officer
DMPS Public Safety
Terry Allfree has been with Des Moines Public Schools for 4 1/2 years and is the senior officer during the afternoon shift for DMPS Public Safety. The afternoon shift is tasked with ensuring safety and security of all after school activities including athletic events. Officer Allfree brings a wealth of emergency response experience to the department as he currently serves as a police officer for Prairie City and the Iowa State Fair on a part-time basis.
In his spare time, he likes to spend time with his grandkids and volunteers as a firefighter with the Colfax Fire Department.
Praveen Bannikatti
Principal
Virtual Campus
Praveen Bannikatti is making big moves at Virtual Campus in his first year as Principal. He and the team have drastically improved student attendance and Grade Level instruction while also retaining students at record levels. Additionally, Praveen has aligned schedules with brick-and-mortar high schools to increase student opportunities and create seamless enrollment options for students within DMPS and those seeking a high-quality virtual learning option from outside of our city. The future of Virtual Campus, post-pandemic, is bright thanks to his leadership.

author: Angelica Dino
title: Manitoba Court orders shared parenting plan in high-conflict case involving family violence
text:
Manitoba Court orders shared parenting plan in high-conflict case involving family violence The decision comes after the mother refused to move the children back to Winnipeg as recommended
By Angelica Dino 13 Jun 2024 Share The Manitoba Court of King's Bench resolved a high-conflict parenting dispute involving two young boys exposed to family violence by mandating a shared parenting plan following the mother's refusal to move the children back to Winnipeg.
The issue in M.I.M. v. B.S.D. , 2024 MBKB 80 involves a family conflict exacerbated by the mother‚Äôs unilateral relocation of the children an hour from the father‚Äôs home. Both parents accused each other of domestic violence during and after their relationship, with both providing evidence of physical and verbal altercations. The father presented a narrative of the mother‚Äôs violent behaviour, supported by digital evidence, while the mother claimed that the father had been physically and verbally abusive.
The family evaluator, Elaine Garrett, concluded that the best interests of the children would be met by a shared parenting schedule, provided the parents lived closer to each other. Garrett‚Äôs assessment found that the current arrangement, involving lengthy travel, was not optimal for the children. She recommended that the mother move closer to Winnipeg to facilitate the shared parenting schedule. Alternatively, if the mother refuses, the children should live primarily with the father.
Most Read Husband's transfer of matrimonial home to wife fraudulent: Ontario Court of Appeal BC Supreme Court awards damages in ICBC privacy breach class action How to spot ChatGPT output masquerading as legal analysis During the trial, both parents testified extensively about their troubled relationship and their respective parenting abilities. The father emphasized his desire for a stable, conflict-free environment for the children, while the mother highlighted the positive impact of the relocation on the children's social lives.
The Court of King‚Äôs Bench noted the need to minimize the children's exposure to ongoing parental conflict. The judge highlighted that both parents exhibited coercive and controlling behaviour, with the mother particularly noted for her threats and attempts to manipulate the father. The court also acknowledged the father's efforts to avoid conflict and the stepmother‚Äôs role in maintaining a peaceful environment.
The court recognized the children's Indigenous heritage, as they have Metis heritage on their mother's side and Nigerian heritage on their father's side. The parents were encouraged to incorporate the children's cultural backgrounds into their upbringing.
In terms of decision-making, the court granted the father final decision-making authority on major issues if the parents could not agree. The court ordered both parents to attend counselling and parenting programs to address family violence and improve their co-parenting skills. Ultimately, the court‚Äôs decision prioritized the best interests of the children.

author: @LorraineActu
title: La Lorraine plac√©e en vigilance jaune orages et orange pour les crues : le point sur la situation | Lorraine Actu
text:
Voir mon actu Suivre Lorraine Actu M√©t√©o France a plac√© les d√©partements des Vosges et de la Meurthe-et-Moselle en vigilance orange crues . La Lorraine est quant √† elle enti√®rement plac√©e en vigilance jaune pour les orages .
L‚Äôalerte a d√©but√© ce vendredi 2 ao√ªt 2024 √† 6h et reste valable jusqu‚Äôau samedi 3 ao√ªt √† minuit.
Des orages attendus en Lorraine ce vendredi Alors que des orages pourraient s‚Äôabattre sur l‚Äôancienne r√©gion cet apr√®s-midi, de fortes pr√©cipitations se sont d√©j√† abattues sur le d√©partement des Vosges jeudi en fin d‚Äôapr√®s-midi.
Cela a conduit √† une ¬´ ‚Äâr√©action significative ‚Äâ¬ª sur le tron√ßon du Madon , comme l‚Äôindique Vigicrues . ¬´‚ÄâLe pic de crue √† la station de Mirecourt a √©t√© atteint √† 2h30 du matin ce vendredi. La hauteur observ√©e √©tait de 3,30 m . Les niveaux sont √† la baisse sur l‚Äôamont du tron√ßon. L‚Äôonde de crue se situera sur le secteur de Pulligny dans la journ√©e de vendredi. Les pr√©cipitations attendues pour la journ√©e de vendredi ne devraient pas g√©n√©rer de nouvelles r√©actions sur le tron√ßon du Madon‚Äâ¬ª, peut-on lire.
Des inondations importantes dans les Vosges Dans les Vosges, les crues ont donn√© lieu √† d‚Äôimportantes inondations autour du secteur de Dompaire.
Contact√©e par Lorraine Actu , la pr√©fecture recensait √† 7h du matin 190 interventions men√©es par les secours et 115 pompiers et 40 gendarmes mobilis√©s. Aucun bless√© n‚Äôest √† d√©plorer. Elle fait cependant √©tat de nombreux d√©g√¢ts mat√©riels .
Suivez toute l‚Äôactualit√© de vos villes et m√©dias favoris en vous inscrivant √† Mon Actu .

author: MENAFN
title: South Africa Warns Citizens Against Fighting For Israel | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - Daily News Egypt) The South African government has warned its citizens that they could face prosecution at home if they join the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) to fight in Gaza, where President Cyril Ramaphosa has accused Israel of committing‚Äúgenocide‚Äù against the Palestinians.
The foreign ministry said it was‚Äúgravely concerned‚Äù by reports that some South Africans have joined or are planning to join the IDF in the ongoing conflict in Gaza.
‚ÄúSuch action could potentially violate international law and amount to further international crimes, making them liable for prosecution in South Africa,‚Äù the ministry said.
The ministry said that South Africans need prior government approval to legally fight in Israel. It also said that naturalised citizens risk losing their South African nationality if they engage in a war that the country‚Äúdoes not support or agree with‚Äù.
South Africa has been a staunch supporter of the Palestinian cause, with the ruling African National Congress (ANC) party often comparing it to its own struggle against apartheid. It has strongly condemned Israel's attacks on Gaza, which have killed more than 10,000 people, according to the Hamas-run health ministry. It has also recalled all its diplomats from Israel. On Monday, Ramaphosa denounced the‚Äúgenocidal onslaught and slaughter of the people of Palestine‚Äù at a press conference with pro-Palestinian groups in Johannesburg.

author: Simply Wall St
title: Heiwa (TSE:6412) Has Announced A Dividend Of ¬•40.00
text:
Heiwa Corporation (TSE:6412) has announced that it will pay a dividend of ¬•40.00 per share on the 10th of December. The dividend yield will be 3.9% based on this payment which is still above the industry average.
AI is about to change healthcare. These 20 stocks are working on everything from early diagnostics to drug discovery. The best part - they are all under $10bn in marketcap - there is still time to get in early.
Heiwa's Future Dividend Projections Appear Well Covered By Earnings
A big dividend yield for a few years doesn't mean much if it can't be sustained. Prior to this announcement, Heiwa's dividend was only 60% of earnings, however it was paying out 131% of free cash flows. The company might be more focused on returning cash to shareholders, but paying out this much of its cash flow could expose the dividend to being cut in the future.
Over the next year, EPS is forecast to expand by 19.8%. If the dividend continues along recent trends, we estimate the payout ratio will be 51%, which is in the range that makes us comfortable with the sustainability of the dividend.
 See our latest analysis for Heiwa
Heiwa Has A Solid Track Record
The company has an extended history of paying stable dividends. There hasn't been much of a change in the dividend over the last 10 years. Slow and steady dividend growth might not sound that exciting, but dividends have been stable for ten years, which we think makes this a fairly attractive offer.
Dividend Growth May Be Hard To Achieve
Some investors will be chomping at the bit to buy some of the company's stock based on its dividend history. However, things aren't all that rosy. Heiwa has seen earnings per share falling at 3.8% per year over the last five years. If the company is making less over time, it naturally follows that it will also have to pay out less in dividends. It's not all bad news though, as the earnings are predicted to rise over the next 12 months - we would just be a bit cautious until this can turn into a longer term trend.
In Summary
In summary, while it's good to see that the dividend hasn't been cut, we are a bit cautious about Heiwa's payments, as there could be some issues with sustaining them into the future. While the low payout ratio is a redeeming feature, this is offset by the minimal cash to cover the payments. We would probably look elsewhere for an income investment.
Investors generally tend to favour companies with a consistent, stable dividend policy as opposed to those operating an irregular one. However, there are other things to consider for investors when analysing stock performance. Just as an example, we've come across 2 warning signs for Heiwa you should be aware of, and 1 of them is concerning. Looking for more high-yielding dividend ideas? Try our collection of strong dividend payers.

author: @nuevodiaibague
title: Reacciones por el fallecimiento de Manuel Elkin Patarroyo; as√≠ despiden al cient√≠fico tolimense | El Nuevo D√≠a
text:
PUBLICIDAD
Este 9 de enero, el pa√≠s perdi√≥ a uno de sus m√°s grandes cient√≠ficos. Manuel Elkin Patarroyo. Su muerte ha conmocionado al pa√≠s y ha generado una ola de reacciones de instituciones y figuras p√∫blicas que destacan su legado.
En primera instancia, la Universidad Nacional de Colombia, donde Patarroyo fue docente del Departamento de Patolog√≠a, record√≥ algunos de los premios m√°s importantes que recibi√≥ a lo largo de su vida, entre ellos el Premio Leon Bernard de la Organizaci√≥n Mundial de la Salud, el Premio Pr√≠ncipe de Asturias de Investigaci√≥n Cient√≠fica y T√©cnica, el Premio Nacional de Ciencias Alejandro √Ångel Escobar, y el Doctorado Honoris Causa de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia. "Resaltamos y agradecemos su aporte a la ciencia y la salud de nuestro pa√≠s", destac√≥ la universidad.
Leer:
[¬°Pilas! La Dian inform√≥ que ahora el RUT tiene vigencia indefinida, no se vence](https://www.elnuevodia.com.co/nuevodia/colombia/524407-pilas-la-dian-informo-que-ahora-el-rut-tiene-vigencia-indefinida-no-se-vence)
El Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnolog√≠a e Innovaci√≥n tambi√©n se sum√≥ al homenaje a Patarroyo, calific√°ndolo como "una figura destacada de la ciencia en Colombia". En su mensaje, el ministerio reconoci√≥ la importancia de su trabajo y la dedicaci√≥n que marc√≥ avances significativos en la investigaci√≥n y la academia.
Asimismo, Alejandro G√≥mez, exsecretario de Salud de Bogot√°, rindi√≥ homenaje a Patarroyo, se√±alando que fue "inspiraci√≥n de varias generaciones". En su cuenta de X, G√≥mez destac√≥ que, aunque su trabajo gener√≥ debates, su rol protag√≥nico en la ciencia colombiana nunca debe ser olvidado. Cabe recordar, que Patarroyo estuvo en el foco de la pol√©mica por experimentar con monos nocturnos, sin tener los permisos requeridos de investigaci√≥n.
Leer:
[Por 'exponer' a su esposa en redes, suboficial de la Polic√≠a del Meta enfrenta cargos](https://www.elnuevodia.com.co/nuevodia/colombia/524386-por-exponer-su-esposa-en-redes-suboficial-de-la-policia-del-meta-enfrenta-cargos)
Jos√© Manuel Restrepo, rector de la Universidad EIA y exministro de Hacienda, expres√≥ su tristeza por la partida de Patarroyo. "Hoy Colombia pierde a un grande de la ciencia", coment√≥, agregando que "el profesor me ense√±√≥ mucho, y siempre le estar√© agradecido por su amistad".
Esta redacci√≥n env√≠a un sentido mensaje de condolencias a sus dolientes. (Q.E.P.D)

author: Maritza Uribe Higuera
title: Comunidad de Inform√°tica UACh celebr√≥ 43 a√±os de vida
text:
Su 43¬∞ aniversario cumpli√≥ la Escuela de Ingenier√≠a Civil en Inform√°tica de la Universidad Austral de Chile y este nuevo a√±o de vida fue celebrado con diversas actividades en que particip√≥ la comunidad acad√©mica, estudiantil y funcionarios.
Como ya es tradici√≥n, la primera actividad fue el ‚Äútortazo‚Äù, un encuentro de camarader√≠a en que se apagan las velas de una torta en el frontis del edificio 10.000 que alberga al Instituto y Escuela de Inform√°tica UACh.
Este a√±o, sin embargo, el momento m√°s significativo de las actividades aniversario fue el acto de reconocimiento al ex acad√©mico Luis √Ålvarez Gonz√°lez quien se acogi√≥ a jubilaci√≥n tras cumplir 41 a√±os de servicios.
El profesor Luis √Ålvarez es Ingeniero Civil Electricista y Mag√≠ster en Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica. Ingres√≥ al Instituto de Inform√°tica el 01 de marzo de 1983 y entre las diversas responsabilidades asumidas a lo largo de su carrera acad√©mica fue director de ese instituto entre los a√±os 2000 y 2012, periodo en que con tes√≥n y perseverancia lider√≥ el proceso que permiti√≥ la construcci√≥n del edificio 10.000, que fue inaugurado el a√±o 2010.
Por este motivo, el Instituto de Inform√°tica, dirigido en la actualidad por Eliana Scheihing, prepar√≥ un simb√≥lico acto de reconocimiento que incluy√≥ la instalaci√≥n de una placa recordatoria en el acceso al edificio 10.000 en honor al profesor Luis Alvarez.
La actividad cont√≥ con la participaci√≥n de miembros de los tres estamentos de la comunidad de inform√°tica, instancia que permiti√≥ que algunos de sus integrantes recordaran an√©cdotas y momentos vividos junto al Prof. √Ålvarez, destacando su compromiso y perseverancia para sacar adelante el proyecto de construcci√≥n del edificio que hoy acoge a alrededor de 400 personas.
El acad√©mico comparti√≥ tambi√©n algunos recuerdos de los inicios de la carrera e instituto que en sus primeros a√±os funcion√≥ en el Campus Isla Teja hasta que un incendio ocurrido en 1996 destruy√≥ el espacio que ocupaban y motiv√≥ el traslado al Campus Miraflores.
En sus primeros a√±os en este campus, recuerda el profesor √Ålvarez, ocuparon las dependencias del edificio 400, un recinto de material ligero que no soportaba la carga el√©ctrica de los equipos de los laboratorios. Las condiciones del recinto hac√≠an urgente contar con un edificio acorde a los requerimientos y crecimiento de la comunidad estudiantil. Por lo anterior se√±al√≥ ‚Äúcreo que hice simplemente lo que me correspond√≠a hacer en ese momento, por el cargo que ocupaba‚Äù.
Historia y desaf√≠os de Inform√°tica UACh
En noviembre de 1981 por Decreto de Rector√≠a N¬∞ 438 de la Universidad Austral de Chile nace el Instituto de Inform√°tica y M√©todos Cuantitativos y la Escuela de Ingenier√≠a Civil en Inform√°tica, ambas unidades depend√≠an de la Facultad de Ciencias Econ√≥micas y Administrativas. Posteriormente, el 25 de febrero de 1994 ambas unidades se adscriben a la Facultad de Ciencias de la Ingenier√≠a.
La creaci√≥n de esta carrera en la UACh represent√≥ un enorme desaf√≠o puesto que en los inicios de los 80, la inform√°tica a√∫n no se consideraba una disciplina aut√≥noma. Fue entonces que un grupo de profesores visionarios de distintas especialidades comenz√≥ a definir lo que ser√≠a esta nueva disciplina, la que fue creciendo con el aporte de los mismos estudiantes que se convertir√≠an en los primeros inform√°ticos del sur de Chile.
As√≠ lo relata el Director de Escuela Jorge Maturana, quien precisa que ‚Äúel primer gran desaf√≠o fue justamente crear la carrera‚Äù. En la actualidad la vigencia de la inform√°tica como disciplina, y la constante demanda del mercado de profesionales que se desempe√±an en √°reas cada vez m√°s diversas plantea otros m√∫ltiples desaf√≠os, entre ellos est√° el aumento de la matr√≠cula.
El a√±o 2024 los matriculados en la carrera superaron los 100 estudiantes en primer a√±o, mientras que en a√±os anteriores no sobrepasaba los 80.
